lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're so high up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Empire State Building.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (loud crash) Through the roof of some portion of the Cerulean Palace.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fore!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hope everyone's okay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, Steve!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I have any movement to move away from the opening of the window, just in case any trickery happens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm okay!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I stand up? I've been watching this whole thing from the ground going: Yay Grog!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Covered in blood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You stand up and look over the side just as Grog kicks it out the window and it disappears out of sight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I find earth elemental Keyleth. (heavy hand slap)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't leave me hanging, says Bigby's Hand!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Whack! It's like a jive hand shake, it's like, yeah! Get a little weasel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to skitter over to my sister and help her up Saving Private Ryan style.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Cure Wounds on myself there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At 3rd-level there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Grog! Chest bump! Huh! Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make athletics checks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make athletics checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For chest bumping each other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (impact) You end up shoving her earth elemental form back about five feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Out the window?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not out the window, you're not close enough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just double checking: can I feel if my Hex has dissipated?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your Hex has dissipated, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just checking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there shards of glass on the ground? Or did they all go outward?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few shards, but a lot of it seems to be broken.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I have Bigby pick up one and bring it back? A tiny piece.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you have a mending spell of any kind?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. You're on your own, fuckface.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not fixing it, I just thought it might be nice, good god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How many hit points do you heal, Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm at 28 hit points now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28 hit points. All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, what are you going to do now?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Presents it toward--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take that, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take it. Looking at it, it's a small brass flute. Looks simple. Like a penny whistle, almost. As you're about to blow on it, J'mon puts their hand up and says, "It knows the melody to "call Devo'ssa but once."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To call who?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Devo'ssa."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that a name that you go by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Devo'ssa is the guardian of this city." J'mon stands back and slowly extends their arms as a sudden burst of wind once again fills the room, swirling around, sending the silks tangling about once more, seeming stronger than what was brought in from the shattered window earlier. Your hair is being tossed and you watch as the lithe creature steps back, the shape bending and swelling behind the silks passing in front as it backs up toward the opposite side of the chamber on the outside of the balcony. You watch the flashing of color, of green and dark gold. A shadow takes the floors, the new form before you holds most of the room, lording over the throne (heavy footsteps). Wings (whooshing noise) unfurl as you see before you the form of the city's protector: a massive brass dragon, scales glistening in the window-fractured sunlight, wings and tail tip becoming a gradient into green at the end. Incredible, frightening, beautiful. The dragon's head curls down, over where the throne was moved, their head massive by comparison to you and reminiscent of most of your recent dragon fights, though there is almost a smile and benevolence to their presence. The same black eyes, with a smoldering molten pupil still stand there, staring back at you. "I share with "you my secret. There is now trust between you and I. Do not forsake it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Never.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a greater gift than we could have hoped for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Time is ever fleeting."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When we call your guardian, is that how you'll know that we're calling you as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am the guardian."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get it. I'm really smart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She lost a lot of blood.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (coughs) Also, like a big giant gash right here. I'm going to hold it together. For now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ahem. Excuse me. Your imminence-- imminence? Eminence. As we are strangers in this foreign land, we were also wondering if you would lend us some sort of a calling card, something that proves that we are friends of the state, it might serve us well as we are automatically suspicious as we walk around your great city.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I wave my giant hand that I've enlarged.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or no. Either way, we're good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I get the feeling that perhaps, even such a thing would make us even more of a target, perhaps?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dragon leans forward, the head coming down straight to you. Their maw right across from your size, one of their front teeth is about up to your waist by comparison. (heavy breathing) (chuckles) "You are sly, gnome." Turns around and reaches into the same box that carried the flute, pulls out a chain that dangles, fluttering in the wind, and hands it to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a four-day Comic-Con badge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Professional!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Only one day."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sunday? Motherfucker! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The chain, as you grasp it-- it's dropped into your hand and you look at it. There appears to be a brass emblem with a single circular sapphire set into it. "This is a symbol of my "crest. Few should argue should they be under my sway."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you so much. And I drop six inches, which is to my knee, and bow my head in supplication.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan! Beep-beep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He means "be pleased."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Be pleased.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Before we depart, my lord, I would ask perhaps some local knowledge. We have magical items that we require wisdom as to their origin and their function. Who would you trust in this city? Would you know who to trust in this city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thinks for a second.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Flips through his notes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A little Rolodex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His Trapper Keeper. I like that everyone has a Trapper Keeper.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Large brass Trapper Keeper.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You hear the Velcro.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The iPad is rebooting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Neon pinks and purples.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Updating? Goddamn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (as Devo'ssa) "I love Night Rider."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How am I supposed to remember "beep-beep" from two weeks ago?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are many who I would call friends, or trustworthy. The list would be long."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For Vestiges. For things that are old.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You would seek Headmaster James Kryon."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: James Kryon?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Krylon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Head of the Crystal Chateau's program for arcane arts and training."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will not tell him of anything other than our gentle acquaintance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Crystal Chateau-- what was that last bit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Crystal Chateau."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Got it. Sure. Crystal Chateau.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Old magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a two year professional degree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how to spell chateau. I really don't know how to spell it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy, what's the proper way to leave a royal chamber?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And you leave, facing them in reverence.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you for having patience, put your head, and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Be pleased. Don't say the words, just do the things. I didn't tell you what to say, I told you what to do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see there are dents in its armor, but it's still standing. Apparently didn't seem to take that much damage from the impact of the fall. It takes the blade and drags it behind it as it moves around J'mon, who steps back as the golem goes back under the balcony and then begins to climb back up outside to whatever strange device or platform it was affixed to before it dropped.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Marvelous piece of engineering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have many throughout the palace."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your technology is impressive, your craftsmanship beyond anything I have ever seen, and there is nothing more pleasing than a monarch with a sense of humor. Bless you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My patience for your honeyed words grows thin." (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that felt good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was so good, too!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, be on your way. I suspect when the time comes to call me you'd best be ready. Now." Turns around and with a whirl, the wind picks up again and the form shrinks down leaving, once again, in the space as the shadow shrinks, the lithe form of J'mon Sa Ord. They walk back to the throne as the throne seems to magically lift up and cover the box that was there beneath it before. Sits back on the throne, crosses their knees onto the throne, leans on one side of the armrest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we ask how to tell if someone else is a dragon? Is there a tell?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They won't tell you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because I think that's their secret.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I begin walking out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we all walk out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Backwards. I'm going to keep holding my slashed--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That should actually give you excellent posture for a slight bow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to cast Lay on Hands through my arm around her shoulder and give her a big five hit points.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, thank you. I'm in the thirties now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like the life force of two kittens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two kittens worth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys step back into the platform. The door closes. The chains shudder and begin to unfurl as the platform lowers down once more, giving you the view over the vast expanse of Ank'Harel and the deserts beyond.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, in the see-through elevator?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just us, no Grand Maven?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No Grand Maven. It finally reaches the bottom floor. The door opens once again, and there you see the Grand Maven surrounded by twelve different servants that are now picking up pieces of shattered rooftop, broken furniture, and a large crater that is now jammed in the center of what was once the waiting room where you guys were previously set. Furniture scattered and totally ruined, and there seems to be an air of haste in making sure that it doesn't stay like this for long.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So sorry about that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did anyone die?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thankfully, no. There was no death. You are lucky this time."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just a heart attack and a metaphor for our entire existence, that's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you see a javelin? No? Maybe? Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we look around for it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to have to take a walk around the tower for a javelin. You threw it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How high is the top of the tower?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell. A few hundred feet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A few hundred feet up, I chucked the shit out of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could be around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know the needle in the desert metaphor?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a needle in the desert-- is that a thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I've heard it before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Many a wise and learned creature--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wish to take some time to go ahead and try and figure out a trajectory and where it may have gone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to sit down and do a little math and see if I can get a vague sense.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to ask the Grand Maven: Flying, is that sort of weird here, or is that totally okay? On a broom, maybe? I don't want to do anything that's wrong here. I feel like I might be able to see it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as I understand, there is no issue with flying within Ank'Harel."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not old math.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: New math. He's finding fractals and shit over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you roll a natural 20?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Weirdly enough, I've figured out--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He just created the Mandelbrots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy, point me in the direction. I'll fly and get it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You became the animated gif of the cat that gets the flower on its head and sees through space and time. You guys watch as Percy zones out for five minutes, the hand moving at a rapid pace across the paper.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I found a window and I'm doing the Beautiful Mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This does allow you, whoever wants to lead this expedition, one investigation check to possibly even recover anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I fly? I feel like I could fly down and get it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll fly with her and use the math to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Point me in the direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the two of you are using the broom. It only has space on it for one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hang.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Percy's hanging from underneath as you fly up a few hundred feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold tight, Percy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've locked my gauntlet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm holding onto one of his wrists as I'm flying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm watching in case I need to catch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch them vanish in a darker and darker spot as they get higher into the sky. Percy. Go ahead and make a wisdom saving throw. You've not been this high before and the sheer perspective and the fact that you have very little affixing you to this broom, we're going to see if you can overcome this singular human fear of heights.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, Percy, you're totally fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm not. Oh, I can reroll a saving throw, can't I? Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, as a fighter, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can reroll a saving throw, because I'm going to pretend that number didn't happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indomitable Will, this is a perfect use for it, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to do it again. I have one more, so I'm going to blow them all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I'll let you do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Better!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fight that vertigo, fight it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go there. That's a wisdom, that's 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. You feel quivering of the broom as Percy's hands are beginning to shake and you see the fingers constantly flutter. As you look down, about to ask if he's okay, you watch as (vomit noise) this spray of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I throw up, too, because anytime I--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This was a very poor decision!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, you watch as you see a gentle rain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have we gone forward, or have we just gone straight up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gone straight up in an arc.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we're not going to hit them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me, but this is poetic justice if I have ever seen it. That is beautiful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This has been the metaphor game. This is a metaphor for our entire existence.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, some poor folks in Ank'Harel right now are having a really bad afternoon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I do a Gust cantrip overtop of us to keep from getting splattered.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to keep my hand on your wrist, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not going to look down. I'm going to look ahead. I'm good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He directs you vaguely where it may have landed. I need you to make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's your jam.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try this fancy little dice here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to have to roll crazy high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shut up!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, that's a seven, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a one. I'm going to blame it on Matt Abernathy. Thanks for that opal dice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it the opal dice again?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What the fuck?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He got opal dice and it-- okay. That's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We love you, Abernathy, don't listen to her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys approach the outskirts of the building you saw on the way in. What you see before you, with the little bit of light that dapples the edge of the Suncut Bazaar reflects across metallic framing on the sides of the building. The walls appear to be dark wood leafed with brass and gold, a beacon of precious metal at many points throughout the structure. It looks to be three stories in its entirety. A half-dozen armed guards not adorned in the guise of the Hands of Ord stand at each entrance, probably privately owned by the establishment, and you hear loud music and cheering bursting from within. You catch a chiseled signed across each doorway arch that read "Drensala Quan: Luck's Run."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drensala Quan, which is the Marquesian speak for "Luck's Run" with the Common translation beneath it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I understand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you at your own paces walk through the front doors, the scents of sweat, perfumes, and tobacco immediately hit your nostrils, as the lively melodies of two musical groups compete from across the establishment, forming a strange discordant sound towards the center of the main room. Large square tables draped in crimson cloth fill the space from one end to the other, different shapes and sizes, crowds of different numbers huddled around each. You see three dozen patrons of all walks of life tending to their various games of chance. Card tables, dice games, even a small contained race table in the far corner stir cheers and anguish. You see servants--

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Servants dressed in uniformed long shirts of dark gray and gold to match the building's exterior rush drinks, food, and coin between tables as you begin to push through the crowd. You come upon, Keyleth, first, as you push past, to the far room there is a long table with a series of curved, almost miniature maze-like paths and there are five paths that all run alongside each other. As you glance over the crowd, you see five desert lizards about that long that are all being held in cages at one end. And you see a bunch of individuals that are currently in the process of setting bets down on the central table with a number of colored squares around it. They're putting different amounts stacked up on the side, and they're all speaking in a language you don't understand. As you approach and glance over, some of them stop and glance over their shoulder at you, and then go back about their business, not paying attention.

And there look to be two guards flanking them and one man at the very end of the table that currently looks to have his hand on a single doorway that is at the front of these cages and is in the process of currently counting up and keeping track of all the best that are being placed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to go up to the guy.

lines.text: "This is my surprised face. This is Quan a Drensal, or The Run of Luck. It is a traditional "old Marquet game of chance. It's what the casino is partially named after. It was founded on this "particular sport, if you will. People bet on which lizard reaches the end first. Then the people who "choose correctly make a profit. The second makes half back what was bet. The rest lose all to the house."

lines.text: He goes, "If you wish to put down enough money to make it worth my while to inspect your "investment then perhaps we can talk. However tourists I keep away from the money making."

lines.text: Because this is going to largely--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Very discreetly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Verbal and somatic so yeah. Sleight of hand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that a one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Of course it's a one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Keyleth, don't get arrested again!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're like the biggest felon of our group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not even two minutes in the Luck's Front Casino, you lean forward and begin muttering beneath your breath the various druidic incantations and as your fingers begin to manipulate the spectrums of divine energies in your hand, a giant, meaty arm claps down on your hand and pulls you to the side, and the guard pulls you off your feet at his face. "Excuse me, are you "trying to do funny business?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm very bad at funny. You talk to other people in our group for funny.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm ignoring this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are out of the Run." And the other gentleman grabs your shoulder and they begin pushing you out, towards the exit of the Luck's Run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, don't, come on, man. Look--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anybody do anything?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you're conversing with this gentleman, you watch as Keyleth gets pushed very forcefully towards the back door on the opposite side of the chamber and kicked out onto the street; like full on boot-to-the-ass, about a three foot arc before slamming onto the dark red cobblestone streets of the Suncut Bazaar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys. I just got kicked out of a casino! I'm so cool! I'm cool, Scanlan, I'm cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By the way, you lost your concentration and currently the shoulders are now dampered.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, I'm a little soggy, but I'm so cool!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was really cool, Keyleth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'll put 25 on Thordak.

lines.name: KEYLETH
lines.text: Yeah, can I forward my bet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's put 25 on Thordak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not putting any money on Thordak.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You never actually put your money down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh good, I didn't lose 200 gold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to put 25 on Thordak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to put 25 on the second one that doesn't have any bets.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, let's see here; we have 25 on Thordak and then we have--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The one that you said hasn't--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is Sonpa.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If it's any consolation, that was totally adorable. Just wait outside for us; we'll be out in a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And how much money you put down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 25 gold as well. All right, no, I don't want to look like I'm putting down the minimum; that's pathetic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we're learning the game. No one's going to give you anything. We're learning the game. We don't have to be big spenders here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 25 gold. You've got to spend big to make big, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, but you've got to learn the game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as we come around, we are rolling for each individual lizard for the entirety of this endeavor. Yeah, I have rolls for all the different lizards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's adorable. Go underdog!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. Rul. Be prepared. All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's just rolling once to see--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's 2d4 for each one to see how well they do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 2d4! It's your rules, you could do anything! It could be 1d8! Why does it have to be 2d4?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What a good excuse to finally order a d9 and have the d9 only for this game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (giggles) Only for lizard racing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Makes no sense!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They come around the far end and they come rushing back on the opposite side of the table. People are shouting. One gentleman to the left of you, Vex, seems to have some large cigar-type thing and is blustering out smoke in your vicinity, making you cough a bit, but you're still focused on this. You watch as Rul pulls ahead; Thordak pulls ahead and pulls back. Sonpa pushes forward, and Wendis is falling behind. De'vossa gets close and barely scoots past, and De'vossa is the winner.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I get anything for second place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Second place, you get back half of what you bet so you get 13 gold pieces back. You lose your bet. A few other gentlemen seem to be happy and collect their winnings, and far more seem to be disappointed with the outcome. Some leave; a few more fill the spaces and come back around. The Run of Luck is complete.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's it like outside?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) What's it like outside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They prefer to actually shop during the evening, whatever their wares may be, you don't know. But it seems lively.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's dark, and I'm in a shady alleyway, and I'm alone. It's great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, maybe go out to the front where the people are. You don't need to be in the back with the dumpster.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, no, I guess so. But it's so pretty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It takes everything in my power not to keep betting, but we should probably walk away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's try another game; I'm not feeling this one. I don't like betting on live little--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As we walk around, we keep an eye out for Scanlan's red shirt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm trying to wander away from them as best I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. So you keep your way wandering through the casino, looking over different games and such. You come across a card game. This one you've actually heard of it though you haven't actually seen it played before. It's called the Gambit of Ord. It's a competitive card game between a group of card players at a table. That actually has a buy in, but can raise per round back and forth based on who drops out and who doesn't. There is a dice game called Avandra's Favor that involves you actually rolling 2d6 and if you get either a seven or a 12, you win, but you can double the bet to add an additional d6 to try and get either a seven or a 12 if the numbers don't quite meet one or the other.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go to the dice game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go to the Avandra's Favor tables.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to use my gold dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you have to wait a moment as there is a small line of people queued up to go ahead and place their bets for the dice. Each person is betting on each individual as they go in, whether or not they're going to make it. You wait for about 15 or so minutes before you watch a couple folks lose horribly and walk away very sorrowful about how much they lost in trying to push their luck as they step away and it's finally your turn. And the woman who's currently helping this table goes, "And you, miss, you are here to play?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, Avandra's Favor?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right! So what is your initial bet, my dear?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't actually remember what you said the rules were, so what's the minimum bet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "25 gold pieces."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much for the extended bet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How much do you want?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To get the third die?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think you roll first--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then you add, you can double your bet to add--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To add an additional die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Then I'm going to put 25 down, just to see how it goes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "25 gold pieces, please."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mark that off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I'm marking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She slides it into your square. "All right, now, roll the dice, and may Avandra be with you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, what am I rolling?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 2d6. You got it. Where's my other?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the most important roll--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of my life. They're gold dice, they're the gold dice. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Eight? Ah."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god! This is a hard game! You lose really easily!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beyond seven, very close! Now, I could take the coin, or you could double your bet and add one "more die."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To get to 12?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To get to 12, or any combination of seven of two, or all three must be 12.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, I'm going to double my bet and I'm going to throw one more dice in the --

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "50 gold."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 50 gold, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes the rest. All right, go ahead and add one more dice. Eight plus--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, it was almost a four! It was a five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Avandra is not by your side this moment. I am so sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's fine, it's really super-duper fun!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I'm going in as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, 25 gold?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 25 gold from my wonderful--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, roll the dice, and may Avandra be with you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy luck!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it only work with 20s?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He didn't even look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "First at the table! Avandra has kissed upon your forehead! Please, take your winnings." And she gives you 50 gold back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've made money now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a streak at this point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll put 25 more in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "25 gold? Oh, but you've already proven that this has been conquerable. Are you sure 25 is all "you wish to pay?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How long she may last, we do not know!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 25 is fine. I don't believe in luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hmm."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Roll your dice."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mm, unfortunate."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll put in the 25 for one more die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, a bet of 50. Roll your one more die."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The goddess left you. Sorry."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was a wonderful thrill. Good evening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good evening to you as well."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I tip her two extra gold, because that's what you're supposed to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My turn!" He sits down, and other folks come in and begin to watch his next turn go. As this is happening, you're making your way through the casino.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's find the cheap drinks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I've forgotten, Matt, did they say to meet in a specific spot, or was it they'll know you from your red shirt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They'll know you from your red shirt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (clears throat, whispers) I'm the guy. And keep walking if they don't--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 20 minutes of this as you're watching over, and some folks look down, expecting to see a child, are spooked by it. In your time here, you've only really come across maybe two other gnomes. They're not very prominent here in Ank'Harel as a people, so some folks give you an odd look to the side, a sideways glance as you step around. At one point you do feel one hand clasp onto your shoulder. You glance up and you see a nice, billowing, dark blue silk shirt across a half-orc gentleman with his hair slicked back, short, over the edge of his scalp. He has a really well-trimmed goatee and a very big hoop gold earring in one ear. His hand is wrapped around your shoulder and he goes, "So. Verdaven said we are to speak, yes?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, then. Follow me to more private quarters where we can have a conversation."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lead the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He releases your shoulder and begins walking up the stairs to the second floor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll join him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we see him walking up the stairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join in that perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You kept your eye the whole time, that was your goal, so you see this happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, get me a drink!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So yeah, Percy, Vax, and Vex, all three of you see Scanlan led upstairs, trailing behind this well-dressed half-orc individual.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If they have a Chardonnay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to go red.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That works. A Shiraz would be phenomenal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys following, or are you staying where you are?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These stairs are peopled? Or are they empty other than Scanlan and this other guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Occasional foot traffic up and down. There does appear to be one of the various hired ruffians to keep the peace around this vicinity at the landing, up where the stairs stop and then head further up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is the gambling only at the first level, or is it up higher levels as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't been to the second floor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I'll, after a little bit, grab a drink and then--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Drunkenly head up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you guys head to get a drink.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I ride my 20 up the stairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say at this point, because you're no longer hiding in a corner, you're actually entering a social place, you'll have to go ahead and roll another stealth check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's fine, 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as opposed to just being out of sight, you are trained in the idea of blending in, making various subtle movements to not catch anyone's attention, and to match the energy of the room about you so as to not stand out amongst the crowd. You adjust some of your clothing to match some of the shoulder-tossed shawls that some of the folks in here wear, and you naturally fall into the general atmosphere of the casino.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm still wearing the fancy whites that Percival put over me the other day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not a worry. You follow up the stairs and up top you do see there are a couple more tables in a center room, and six doors on each side of this long run, before another staircase heads up to the third floor of this establishment. The half-orc walks to the fourth door on the left, pulls out a key, pulls the door open, glances over his shoulder for a second, and enters the room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will gladly follow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you turn the corner and enter the room, there is a singular table. There are two chairs facing each other. There appears to be some small-- (mooing in music track)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's an ox in the corner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can do anything you want in this place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much for ten minutes with the ox? Be fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you enter the room, you see there are a few tables on the far side. There is a window that looks out that is currently closed, and the half-orc is now standing on the opposite side of the table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (clears throat) So what have you got for me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You enter and sit down?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes, I enter and sit down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you sit down. As you sit down, the door closes behind you and you see the half-elf that you had met earlier in the alleyway was behind the door, walks around and leaves the room, closing the door behind him. You hear (lock clicking). The half-orc has sat down and goes, "So you were "asking about spice."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Again, maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Specifically, if I am to understand, 200 gold worth of fusaka?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe more, if it's of a higher quality.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So it is difficult to acquire this. I would say one for 250, or both for 400 gold."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do I know it's of a quality I'm accustomed to, from my homeland?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because I have a reputation to uphold. If you wish not to have any, perhaps you find "business with less viable options."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Forgive me, I'm not from around here. I don't know of your reputation. Could I possibly have a sample to see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While he's doing that, I'm pretending to sort of drunkenly lean on the wall outside that door.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did that just happen?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you glance and look around the side, you can see a tan-skinned half-elf in robes waiting impatiently with his back against the door that you barely saw Scanlan disappear into after he walked out. He gives you a look over. "Should you wish, but be careful not to inhale too "deeply." Then he takes the rope and unfurls and unties it, takes the satchel, and pushes it over towards you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The whole satchel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The entire satchel.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know if it's a powder, or a plant?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's the cinnamon challenge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it look like?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, what does it look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's halfway across the table. You go ahead and pull it towards you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'll pull it towards me, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a light thing, it's a very heavy material. As you pull it forward, it looks like very, very finely mulched bark almost, or shavings, and it has this pungent smell like dried cheese with a hint of cedar.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this shit! It's not a fine powder, it's chunky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's chunky to an extent, and as you're looking over it, he goes, "It requires additional "refining for use, of course."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course. This isn't my first rodeo, friend.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Put it in your lip, put it in your lip!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Being that I play stringed instruments, I have long nails, so I'll take my pinky and sort of dip down and get a little on the end of my pinky, smell it a bit, on my gums a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sweet Christmas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The cedar wood chips.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The smell is strong, and the taste is stronger. It is not pleasant to the tongue. The aftertaste does have a unique zest to it. There is a slight numbness, and while the initial flavor is awful, the lingering flavor is actually quite nice, like a spiced meat almost. It catches you off guard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spiced meat. Am I feeling high at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a constitution check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How fast is your metabolism?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Constitution check? I've never checked my constitution --

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Saving throw. Well, either way it's 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. Best you can tell there's no immediate effect. You don't know what it's supposed to do. It doesn't seem to be having an effect on you at the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll do a little bit more. Get it on my tongue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Up the nose?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sniffing) Just a little bit more to see if it's doing anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make another constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you satisfied?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not dead. I guess that's good. You know, where I'm from sometimes we burn it and inhale it that way. Is that done? What methods do you guys use here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His head pulls back a bit and he goes, "You may do as you wish with it upon purchasing. That "is up to you. I am a little worried that you may not be regulating your intake."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry about me, friend, all right? My mom and dad, that's their job, all right? All right. I guess I'll take it. Your reputation and the seeming good quality makes me believe that this is of a fine caliber, quality, how that's-- ugh. Stings a little in the eyes, that's all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That it would."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For two satchels like this, why don't we say 300?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His immediate eager lean forward slips back into an arms-crossed. "400 was already a discount."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fair enough. 400 it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "400." He takes the other satchel and is about to push it forward and is seemingly waiting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For me to pay him? Sure, I'll drop four hundred large.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four hundred thousand dollars.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you both wait a moment and pause, you both shove it across at the same time, and he catches the coin pouch after watching you count it across the table. Both your satchels are at your disposal. He goes, "It has been a pleasure doing business with you. If it's not too much to ask, in "case you require further assistance, what shall I call you?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (snorting and giggling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Meat Man. I hope to do more business with you in the future, Meat Man."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And what shall I call you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have a few titles, but in these circles, you may call me Rutur."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rutur?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Rutur."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rutur. And so I'm clear here, this is a drug, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course it is."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Really? I'm not feeling it yet, do I need to do more of it, is that the thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It does not affect you immediately."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. It doesn't?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, great, thanks, bye!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes his coin, gets up, walks around the table, knocks on the door, a couple knocks. It opens, the half-elf peers through. The door opens completely. He stops as you say that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry. I've got two big bags of drugs. Could you give me a backpack or something to put this in? I mean, I can't walk out of the casino holding this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The half-orc rolls his eyes, looks over to the half-elf and goes, (speaking Marquesian). The other one turns. (sighs) "I'll be right back." And he goes to one of the other rooms. In 30 seconds, he comes back with some sort of a backpack-type ensemble and tosses it to you. You catch it. "Now, "should you need more, just ask around the bazaar." And they both quickly head down the stairs past you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As they go, I say to them, remember, we met, but you did not meet the Meat Man.

lines.name: MATT
